name: WiFi Pineapple
title: Advanced WiFi Testing Device
description: Used for wireless network auditing, the WiFi Pineapple is a powerful tool for conducting man-in-the-middle attacks and analyzing wireless traffic.

name: USB Rubber Ducky
title: Keystroke Injection Tool
description: Disguised as a USB drive, this device automates keystrokes at lightning speed to execute payloads on unsuspecting systems.

name: Hak5 LAN Turtle
title: Covert Remote Access Gadget
description: This discreet Ethernet adapter provides persistent remote access, DNS spoofing, packet captures, and man-in-the-middle capabilities.

name: Proxmark3
title: RFID/NFC Hacking Toolkit
description: A powerful tool for RFID analysis, capable of sniffing, reading, and emulating a wide range of RFID and NFC cards.

name: ChameleonMini
title: Portable RFID Emulator
description: An open-source device for RFID emulation and manipulation, useful for penetration testing and card cloning.

name: HackRF One
title: Software Defined Radio (SDR)
description: A powerful SDR platform that allows transmission and reception of radio signals from 1 MHz to 6 GHz. Ideal for RF research.

name: Flipper Zero
title: Hackerâ€™s Swiss Army Knife
description: A portable multi-tool for pentesters and geeks, supporting RFID, NFC, IR, GPIO, and radio protocols.

name: Alfa AWUS036ACH Wi-Fi Adapter
title: Dual-Band WiFi Adapter
description: High-gain USB Wi-Fi adapter with monitor mode and packet injection support, perfect for wireless pentesting.

name: Raspberry Pi 4 Kit
title: Mini Computer for Projects
description: A compact yet powerful kit used in development, automation, and hacking projects. Supports full Linux environments.

name: Bus Pirate v4
title: Serial Protocol Analyzer
description: A universal bus interface that supports UART, SPI, I2C, and other serial protocols, great for embedded debugging.

name: ESP32 Dev Board
title: WiFi & Bluetooth Microcontroller
description: A low-cost microcontroller with WiFi and Bluetooth for DIY IoT and hacking projects. Ideal for wireless security experiments.

name: Yard Stick One
title: Sub-GHz Wireless Transceiver
description: Useful for capturing and transmitting signals in the 300-928 MHz range, great for wireless reverse engineering.

name: Packet Squirrel
title: Covert Network Attack Tool
description: A stealthy network implant that enables man-in-the-middle attacks, packet captures, and remote access over LAN. Ideal for pen testers needing a plug-and-play tool for covert operations.

name: Ubertooth One
title: Bluetooth Sniffer
description: Open-source Bluetooth monitoring device for sniffing and analyzing Bluetooth communications.

name: Keysy RFID Duplicator
title: RFID Cloning Tool
description: Clone access cards easily. Supports 125 kHz RFID tags and simplifies basic access control research.

name: LAN Tap Pro
title: Passive Ethernet Tap
description: A simple and effective tool for passively capturing Ethernet traffic without detection or interference.

name: BeagleBone Black
title: Open Hardware Development Board
description: An open-source single-board computer ideal for embedded development and hardware testing.

name: Alpha Loop Antenna Kit
title: Signal Reception Tool
description: A high-gain loop antenna optimized for improving signal reception in SDR and wireless hacking scenarios.

name: Digispark USB Dev Board
title: Mini USB Microcontroller
description: Tiny, Arduino-compatible board often used for HID-based attacks and automation scripts.

name: P4wnP1 A.L.O.A.
title: Raspberry Pi Zero-based Attack Platform
description: A powerful HID attack tool based on Raspberry Pi Zero that can simulate keyboards, create rogue Wi-Fi APs, and host payloads for social engineering attacks.

name: Plunder Bug
title: Network Sniffer & Debugger
description: A compact LAN tap and sniffer that lets you monitor and capture network traffic using a mobile phone or USB-C laptop.

name: O.MG Keylogger Cable
title: Stealthy Keylogging Cable
description: Looks like a regular USB charging cable, but logs keystrokes, supports remote access, payloads, and real-time command execution.
